Authors: Jamjan Meeboon, Jun Okamoto, Susumu Takamatsu
Title:
Erysiphe actinidicola and E. limonicola: Two new powdery
mildew species (Erysiphales) from Japan
Keywords:
Actinidia, Erysiphaceae, Limonium, molecular phylogeny,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Two new Erysiphe species, viz. Erysiphe actinidicola and
E. limonicola were described on Actinidia polygama and Limonium
tetragonum, respectively, based on morphological and molecular data.
Erysiphe actinidicola is distinguished from E. actinidiae var.
actinidiae by having rather irregularly shaped geniculate-sinuous
chasmothecial appendages, irregularly to dichotomously branched, below
or apically, differences in size of chasmothecia, the number of asci per
chasmothecium and length of appendages. Molecular analyses indicated
that this species forms a clade separated from E. actinidiae var.
actinidiae. Epitype was proposed for E. actinidiae var. actinidiae with
ex-epitype sequences. Based on the DNA sequence differences in the 28S
rDNA and ITS region as well as the morphological differences in the
length of conidiophores, the fungus on L. tetragonum was described as a
new species, E. limonicola.
